latest news.eng_title: Trump Suggests Debate Rules Are Set. Harris' Team Says Otherwise.
latest news.summary: Donald Trump announced that he would participate in a presidential debate with Vice President Kamala Harris hosted by ABC News, suggesting that the debate rules had been resolved. However, a person briefed on the Harris campaign's thinking said the issue of whether microphones will be muted when a candidate isn't speaking remains an open discussion. Trump's team favors muted microphones, while the Harris team does not. Trump wrote that the debate rules will be the same as the last CNN Debate, which was 'calamitous' for President Joe Biden. Harris spokesperson Ammar Moussa said, 'Both candidates have publicly made clear their willingness to debate with unmuted mics for the duration of the debate, but it appears Donald Trump is letting his handlers overrule him.' Trump said, 'Doesn't matter to me, I'd rather have it probably on. But the agreement was that it would be the same as it was last time.'
latest news.title: Trump Suggests Debate Rules Are Set. Harris' Team Says Otherwise.

latest news.eng_title: Trump Agrees to Debates with Harris, but Rules Remain Unclear
latest news.summary: US presidential candidate Donald Trump said he has 'reached an agreement' to participate in debates with Vice President Kamala Harris. The debates are scheduled for September 10, according to CNN. A source familiar with the issue noted that the rules for future debates will largely repeat the conditions used by CNN for the debates on June 27, which included turning off microphones during the other candidate's speech and no audience in the studio. However, in his post on Truth Social, Trump does not mention the turned-off microphones, only stating that the rules will be the same as during his debates with President Joe Biden. Trump's campaign wanted to turn off the microphones throughout the debates, except for the candidate whose turn it was to speak, but Trump later stated that he would prefer to have the microphones on. 'Both candidates publicly stated their willingness to debate with an un-muted microphone throughout the debates to fully enable the exchange of ideas between the candidates, but it seems like Donald Trump allows his handlers to cancel it. Sad!' - said a representative of Harris' campaign.
latest news.title: Трамп договорился с Гаррис о дебатах

latest news.eng_title: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris to Debate on September 10, 2024
latest news.summary: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris have agreed to participate in a presidential debate on September 10, 2024. The debate will take place in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and will be broadcast on ABC News. Although Trump has expressed his dissatisfaction with ABC News, he has agreed to participate in the debate. The debate will be moderated, and the microphones may be muted at times. This is the first debate between Trump and Harris, who will face each other just three months before the presidential election on November 5, 2024.
latest news.title: डोनाल्ड ट्रंप और कमला हैरिस लेंगे चुनावी डिबेट में हिस्सा, 10 सितंबर को होंगे आमने-सामने

latest news.eng_title: Trump and Harris Agree to TV Debate on September 10
latest news.summary: US presidential candidate Donald Trump claims to have reached an agreement for a TV debate with Kamala Harris on September 10. According to Trump, the debate will be held on ABC, following the same rules as the CNN debate on June 27, which was held without a studio audience and with muted microphones for the non-speaking participant. Trump described ABC as the 'most vicious and unfair' news channel in the industry, but stated that the network has assured him that the debate in Philadelphia will be 'fair and just.' Harris had previously declined a debate on Fox News on September 4, but has left the option open to change her mind. ABC News had announced three weeks ago that Trump and Harris would face off on September 10. This is the only scheduled TV debate before the November 5 election between the vice president and the former president.
latest news.title: U-Wahlkampf: Trump: Einigung für Fernsehduell am 10. September mit Harris

latest news.eng_title: Trump Announces Presidential Debate with Harris on ABC
latest news.summary: Donald Trump, the Republican candidate for the US presidential election, announced on his social media platform 'Truth Social' that he has reached an agreement with the Democrats to hold a presidential debate with Democratic candidate Kamala Harris. Trump stated that the debate will be broadcast live on American network 'ABC' on September 10 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He explained that the debate will follow the same rules as the previous debate on 'CNN', where the candidates will stand and not be allowed to bring notes or cheat sheets. Trump said, 'We have received assurances from ABC that this debate will be 'fair and just', and neither side will be given questions in advance.' Trump also revealed that 'Harris has refused to participate in a Fox News debate on September 4, but this date will remain open in case she changes her mind.'
latest news.title: ترامب يعلن عن موعد مناظرته أمام هاريس

latest news.eng_title: US Presidential Elections 2024: Donald Trump Agrees To Debate With Kamala Harris, Sets Specific Conditions
latest news.summary: Donald Trump has agreed to debate Vice President Kamala Harris in the US Presidential Elections 2024, setting specific conditions. The debate will be held on September 10th in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and will be broadcast live on ABC. Trump stated that the rules will be the same as the last CNN debate, including no live audience, muted microphones, and no notes or 'cheat sheets' allowed. Trump also expressed his satisfaction with the assurance from ABC that the debate will be 'fair and equitable' and that neither side will be given the questions in advance. Harris had initially refused to participate in a FoxNews debate on September 4th, but Trump has left the date open in case she changes her mind. A possible third debate with NBC has not been agreed to by the Radical Left.
latest news.title: US Presidential Elections 2024: Donald Trump Agrees To Debate With Kamala Harris, Sets Specific Conditions

latest news.eng_title: Trump confirms ABC debate with Harris will go ahead in September
latest news.summary: Donald Trump has confirmed that he has reached an agreement with Kamala Harris over the rules for their 10 September debate, stating that the format will include muted microphones, similar to the last CNN debate. Trump wrote on Truth Social that the debate will be 'stand up' and candidates will not be allowed to bring notes or 'cheat sheets.' However, Harris's campaign has disputed this, stating that specifics for the debate are still being worked out with ABC News and that Harris has publicly expressed her willingness to debate with unmuted microphones. A spokesperson for Harris's campaign said, 'Both candidates have publicly made clear their willingness to debate with unmuted mics for the duration of the debate to fully allow for substantive exchanges between the candidates – but it appears Donald Trump is letting his handlers overrule him. Sad!' The ABC has not yet publicly commented on the matter.
latest news.title: Trump confirms ABC debate with Harris will go ahead in September

latest news.eng_title: When is the next US presidential election debate? How to watch Trump v Harris
latest news.summary: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump have agreed to face off in a live TV debate on September 10. The debate will be hosted by ABC and will be available to watch on primetime TV, as well as on the ABC app, ABC website, Hulu, and connected devices. The format of the debate has not been announced, but it is likely to include limits on speaking time and switched-off microphones. The debate will cover topics such as the economy, wars in Eastern Europe and the Middle East, and abortion rights. Trump has previously backed out of the debate, but has now recommitted after being accused of avoiding it. Harris said, 'I'm looking forward to it and hope he shows up.' Trump has repeatedly suggested that Harris is not intelligent enough to debate him. The latest opinion poll has given Harris a six-point lead among likely voters.
latest news.title: When is the next US presidential election debate? How to watch Trump v Harris

latest news.eng_title: US election debate in the balance as Trump cries foul - International
latest news.summary: The US presidential debate between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris on September 10 is in doubt due to disagreements over the use of live microphones. Trump has questioned participating in the debate, citing bias from TV broadcaster ABC, while Harris's campaign prefers a return to the norm of keeping microphones on. Harris's communication director, Brian Fallon, said, 'We believe both candidates' mics should be live throughout the full broadcast.' The Trump camp, however, insists on the previously agreed conditions, with Jason Miller stating, 'Enough with the games. We accepted the ABC debate under the exact same terms as the CNN debate.' The debate is scheduled to be held in Philadelphia, with Harris and Trump neck and neck in the polls two weeks before the event.
latest news.title: US election debate in the balance as Trump cries foul - International

latest news.eng_title: Trump-Harris debate on Sept. 10: Will it happen?
latest news.summary: The debate between Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump, scheduled for September 10, is in jeopardy due to disagreements over debate rules. Trump has expressed concerns about debating on ABC, citing biased reporting and a 'Panel of Trump Haters.' The Harris campaign wants microphones to be live all the time, while Trump's campaign argues that they agreed to the same guidelines as the previous CNN debate. Trump's campaign senior adviser Jason Miller said, 'Enough with the games. We accepted the ABC debate under the exact same terms as the CNN debate.' Harris spokesman Brian Fallon responded, 'Trump's handlers prefer the muted microphone because they don't think their candidate can act presidential for 90 minutes on his own.' Kaitlan Collins, a CNN reporter, suggested that Trump is 'nervous' about debating Harris, saying, 'I don't think he's looking forward to it at this point. He is his own liability.'
latest news.title: Trump-Harris debate on Sept. 10: Will it happen?

news knowledge.eng_title: Harris-Trump debate to be held on September 10: Get the details
news knowledge.summary: The presidential debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump will take place on September 10 at 9:00 p.m. at the National Constitution Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The debate will be hosted by Martha Raddatz, Jonathan Karl, Mary Bruce, and Rachel Scott. To participate, candidates must accept the rules and achieve at least 15% support in four independent national surveys of registered voters. The decision on eligibility will be made after September 3, 2024. Additionally, a debate between Tim Walz and JD Vance is scheduled for October 1 and will be moderated by CBS News.
news knowledge.title: Harris-Trump debate to be held on September 10: Get the details

news knowledge.eng_title: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump to Debate on ABC on September 10th
news knowledge.summary: The upcoming presidential debate between candidates Kamala Harris and Donald Trump will take place in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. According to ABC, the event is scheduled for September 10th at 9:00 PM. The debate will be held at the National Constitution Center, a non-profit institution known for its non-partisan approach to constitutional studies. The event will be broadcast on ABC News Live, Disney+, and Hulu. David Muir and Linsey Davis will moderate the debate. A pre-debate special, 'Race for the White House,' will also be presented by Martha Raddatz, Jonathan Karl, Mary Bruce, and Rachel Scott. The debate format has not been announced, but all participants must agree to the established rules and have at least 15% support in four national polls to be eligible. Eligibility will be determined after September 3rd, 2024.
news knowledge.title: ¿Dónde será el debate de Kamala Harris y Donald Trump en ABC el 10 de septiembre?

news knowledge.eng_title: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump to Face Off in First Presidential Debate
news knowledge.summary: The first presidential debate between Democratic candidate Kamala Harris and Republican candidate Donald Trump will take place on September 10 at 9:00 PM (1:00 AM GMT on September 11) at the National Constitution Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, according to ABC, the organizing network. The debate will be moderated by David Muir and Linsey Davis. The debate will also be broadcast on ABC News Live, Disney+, and Hulu. The National Constitution Center is a non-profit institution located near where the US Constitution was written and signed. The debate's format has not been confirmed, but ABC stated that participants must accept the rules without any restrictions and must have at least 15% support in four independent national polls of registered voters. The eligibility of the candidates will be determined after September 3, 2024. Trump proposed three debates with Harris on September 4, 10, and 25, and suggested that they be held on different networks, including Fox, ABC, and NBC. The debate on September 10 is currently the only confirmed one. A separate debate between Tim Walz and JD Vance, the Democratic and Republican vice-presidential candidates, will take place on October 1 and will be moderated by CBS News.
news knowledge.title: Lista la fecha para el primer "cara a cara" entre Donald Trump y Kamala Harris

news knowledge.eng_title: Trump and Harris to Debate in September
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris have confirmed they will participate in debates on September 10 on ABC News. The debates will be held on September 10 on ABC News, according to a statement. Trump had previously announced his willingness to participate in debates with Harris on Fox News on September 4, but Harris' team declined the offer. Trump then sent Harris derogatory messages in response. Trump is now willing to participate in three debates in September and is waiting for Harris' decision. The presidential election in the US is scheduled for November 5, and voters will elect the Electoral College, which will then elect the President and Vice President on December 15, 2024. Additionally, elections for the House of Representatives and one-third of the Senate will take place.

news knowledge.eng_title: US election 2024 - Trump and Harris to Face Off in First Presidential Debate as Election Battle Intensifies
news knowledge.summary: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump and Democratic candidate Kamala Harris will face off in the first presidential debate on September 10, hosted by ABC. Harris's recent entry into the race has energized the Democratic base, with massive fundraising and large rallies in battleground states. Trump, who initially hinted at backing out of the debate, is also pushing for additional debates on September 4 and 25. The upcoming debate is a critical moment as both campaigns recalibrate strategies amid shifting poll numbers.
news knowledge.title: US election 2024 - Trump and Harris to Face Off in First Presidential Debate as Election Battle Intensifies

news knowledge.eng_title: Trump and Harris Set to Face Off in Pivotal TV Debate on September 10 Amid Tightening Race
news knowledge.summary: The upcoming televised debates between Democratic candidate Kamala Harris and Republican candidate Donald Trump on September 10 are expected to have a significant impact on the 2024 US presidential election. Current polling suggests a tight race, with many undecided voters who could sway the final outcome. Trump's recent change of heart regarding participation demonstrates the volatile nature of political strategies. The debates provide a platform for candidates to consolidate support and articulate their vision to a wide audience, with effective communication being pivotal in today's digital age. As the election draws nearer, factors such as voter turnout, debate performance, and campaign narratives will heavily influence public perception and decision-making.
news knowledge.title: Trump and Harris Set to Face Off in Pivotal TV Debate on September 10 Amid Tightening Race
